question.title: Error in Encoding android code using Proguard

node.contents: I am using proguard to secure my android apk from reverse engineering.

astNode.text: I am using proguard to secure my android apk from reverse engineering.

node.contents: But when I completed all the steps which is needed to on proguard tool in my app then it gives error like bellow:

astNode.text: But when I completed all the steps which is needed to on proguard tool in my app then it gives error like bellow:

elements.contents:
[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp] Proguard returned with error code 1. See console
[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp] proguard.ParseException: Expecting type and name instead of just '***' before '(' in line 85 of file 'D:\Ranjana\New folder\DemoProApp\bin\proguard.txt',
[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp]   included from argument number 6
[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp]  at   `proguard.ConfigurationParser.parseMemberSpecificationArguments(ConfigurationParser.java:857)

[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp]  at proguard.ConfigurationParser.parseKeepClassSpecificationArguments(ConfigurationParser.java:490)
[2014-03-11 10:55:04 - DemoProApp]  at proguard.ConfigurationParser.parse(ConfigurationParser.java:139)

node.contents: And my Proguard-project.txt file is like bellow:

astNode.text: And my Proguard-project.txt file is like bellow:

fragments.text:
classes
-dontwarn com.google.ads.** # Temporary workaround for v6.2.1. It gives a warning that    you can ignore
# Add any classes the interact with gson
-keep

.example.** {*;}
 ##---------------Begin: proguard configuration common for all Android apps ----------
-optimizationpasses 5
-dontusemixedcaseclassnames
-dontskipnonpubliclibraryclasses
 -dontskipnonpubliclibraryclassmembers
-dontpreverify
-verbose
 -dump

# Explicitly preserve all serialization members. The Serializable interface
# is only a marker interface, so it wouldn't save them.
-keepclassmembers class * implements

when working with fields.   Proguard
# removes such information by default, so configure it to keep all of it.
-keepattributes Signature

# For using GSON

node.contents: progurad.txt is auto generated file within bin folder we can't modify anything in proguard.txt.

astNode.text: progurad.txt is auto generated file within bin folder we can't modify anything in proguard.txt.

node.contents: You're right. This is a bug in the aapt tool in the Android SDK, which generates the file. It seems to have a problem interpreting one of your resource files. You should try to figure out why it is creating the erroneous line in proguard.txt, and maybe work around it by adapting your resource file. There are a couple of similar reports here on Stack Overflow.

astNode.text: You're right. This is a bug in the aapt tool in the Android SDK, which generates the file. It seems to have a problem interpreting one of your resource files. You should try to figure out why it is creating the erroneous line in proguard.txt, and maybe work around it by adapting your resource file. There are a couple of similar reports here on Stack Overflow.

node.contents: The error message refers to line 85 of file proguard.txt (not proguard-project.txt). That line appears to be missing a method name inbetween the return type (the wildcard ***) and the opening parenthesis for the method arguments.

astNode.text: The error message refers to line 85 of file proguard.txt (not proguard-project.txt). That line appears to be missing a method name inbetween the return type (the wildcard ***) and the opening parenthesis for the method arguments.

node.contents: Note that the Android SDK nowadays contains a standard configuration file that already specifies all the generic Android configuration for you (with -printseeds, -keepattributes, etc).

astNode.text: Note that the Android SDK nowadays contains a standard configuration file that already specifies all the generic Android configuration for you (with -printseeds, -keepattributes, etc).
